italic.text: Patrols are missions to gather information or to control rescue operations. Patrolling could ensure law, order and check crime in a given district.

line.text: In SWORD, patrolling consist of moving along a path defined by waypoints, indefinitely, allowing the agent to gather information.
Lines used by units to adapt their behavior when they reach or cross them.

The agent moves toward each waypoint. The order of the elements in the 'Waypoints' list defines the order of visit. If a visited waypoint is not reachable, the agent moves as close as possible (the agents can move within it), the agent moves to the center, else it moves to a close position (the closest position from the center).
Upon reaching the last waypoints, the agent moves back to the first one and starts again.
The mission ends if another mission (or "the cancel maneuver" fragmentary order) is issued by user.
